description.narrative: By the end of 2020, the government has the capacity to prepare and to implement communication plans for the prevention, the response and the disaster recovery to meet the information and the communication needs of parents and children affected by emergencies.

sector.narrative: Strengthening C4D in Government systems including preparedness for humanitarian action

UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2020, the government has the capacity to prepare and to implement communication plans for the prevention, the response and the disaster recovery to meet the information and the communication needs of parents and children affected by emergencies.

description.narrative: UNICEF's support to emergency response has been operationalised through the BNGRC and the Ministry of Communication. 2019 was marked by effective emergency and disaster response management to strengthen community resilience, but also to strengthen social and community mobilisation during the measles and plague epidemics. Coordination of disaster and risk management has been combined with coordination of epidemics. A total of 3,870,475 people were reached with key messages on health, nutrition, sanitation and hygiene (634,475 people for plague, 336,000 people for cyclones and drought, 2,900,000 people for measles). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of communication networks operational for managing risks and disasters
Number of community leaders engaged in emergency preparedness and response
Number of the target population reached with communication activities for the management of risks and disasters
Number of supporting communication materials for disaster risk management developed and disseminated

% of communes in the affected areas where community dialogues have been conducted to ensure the participation and the feedback of the communities, following a communication plan and in an emergency period
% of community agents in the affected areas who communicate with communities following a communication plan and in an emergency period
% of community radio stations in the affected areas that broadcast programmes following a communication plan and in an emergency period
